post_info.post_title: Porn in public libraries a First Amendment right?

Very interesting debate in Michigan. I can kind of see both sides:
 
 eeekonomy.com/discussion/Should-Adult-Content-at-the-Library-be-Shelved-/62

 
 The problem with the filtering programs is that it often can cut out legitaiment inquires into such subjects as infertility, impotence, dealing with the trauma of
 molestation, birth control, etc etc etc, that people have every right to have access to, and might want to get to a library to find out information from.
 
 I appreciate the desire to keep inappropriate material away from minors, but there also seems to be a lot of people out there that want to impose their hangups on me.
Unless it is illegal to see or make it (i.e.top secret government docs, child porn) it should be accessible at the library or through inter-library loan.

Erm...
 
 Completely aside from the morality of the issue, I can't honestly blame anyone for blocking content even vaguely related to porn on the internet. The free porn pages are often so infested with malware that they are almost like a plague pit that actually leaps at you as soon as it smells you near...

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Porn in public libraries a First Amendment right?
